Tremendous Pow'r! — whose chilling band,</br>Relentless tyrants of the soul,</br>Obedient to thy dread command,</br>The vital springs controul;</br>The gasping tongue no longer free,</br>And pulseless veins betoken thee;</br>The pallid cheek, the haggard eye,</br>And ev'ry fearful mark of wild insanity.

The tortur'd wretch, who courts repose,</br>Prostrate, his thorny couch along,</br>(When the twin-gates of steep unclose,</br>And swarms the airy throng)</br>Starts trembling, as thy shadowy form</br>Urges th' infernal-brooding storm,</br>While famish'd vultures scream for food,</br>And wave the high-plum'd wing, and snuff the scent of blood.

Athwart the dreary church-yard now</br>Forlorn he seeks yon cypress' gloom,</br>Whose sable branches bending low</br>Weep o'er the mould'ring tomb.</br>Calm Peace is fled — but gaunt Despair</br>And agonizing Woe are there.</br>See, murd'rous fiends their victim crave,</br>And yell the mystic chaunt, and drag him to the grave.

Nor to the restless child of pain</br>Thy potent influence is confin'd,</br>Thy Phantoms seize the ardent brain,</br>And sweep the tract of mind;</br>As the pale spectres cross her way,</br>Lo!  RATCLIFF shudders with dismay,</br>Sees the dread Fury's visage low'r,</br>And shake her serpent-torch, and riot in her pow'r.

The down where Guilt reclines his head</br>Thy Ministers with thorns have strown,</br>Thou pressest to the Murd'rer's bed,</br>And mark'st him for thy own.</br>The daring Robber trembles now,</br>The Judge recants his perjur'd vow,</br>And gasping with his latest breath,</br>Pours forth his soul to thee, a penitent in death.

When vanquish'd Reason yields her throne,</br>And bound by Superstition's chain,</br>Whene'er deluded mortals groan,</br>And sigh for hope in vain;</br>All cheerless as thy sable vest,</br>Uncertain pangs distract the breast;</br>Thy hand uprears th' envenom'd dart,</br>Directs its secret course, and points it to the heart.

Thy fears pervade th' embodied air,</br>And blasts that sweep the wintry sky,</br>Rob'd in vindictive terrors, bear</br>The frowning Deity,</br>Wing'd with his all-consuming ire</br>Flashes the vollied lightning's fire,</br>And roar the pealing thunders loud,</br>And speak his threat'ning voice in each tempestuous cloud.

Is this Religion's heav'nly form,</br>Round which bright emanations play,</br>Of pow'r to lull the rudest storm,</br>And chase each cloud away?</br>Why dwells the mind affrighted still</br>On Sinai's flame-encircled hill;</br>When the blest tow'rs of Sion stream</br>With softer tints of grace, and mercy's milder beam?

But the dread Pow'r who rules above</br>Instruct thy Suppliant to revere,</br>And oh!  unite with fervent Love</br>Thy gentler sister Fear.</br>Teach him to bend beneath the rod</br>That arms the chastening hand of God;</br>Kneel prostrate at his holy shrine,</br>And feed the sacred fire with frankincense divine.

Insatiate Queen!  whose rigid sway,</br>Wide o'er the realms of dire affright,</br>Deforms with clouds the smile of day,</br>And scares the steep of night;</br>O'er Innocency's sainted brow</br>Why give thy scorpion-lash to flow?</br>Why chill, that hopes to be forgiv'n,</br>The soul redeem'd from Earth, and dedicate to Heav'n?

In Fate's dread hour when doom'd to part,</br>The dreams of worldly rapture fly,</br>No more to wake the throbbing heart,</br>Or light the asking eye;</br>Borne on the dark funereal gale,</br>What forms of direful omen sail?</br>What black'ning clouds of sulphur roll?</br>Why gapes the deep abyss to catch the parting soul ?

Celestial Hope!  yet deign to stay,</br>Oh!  chase these visions of despair,</br>For thou canst cheer the destin'd way,</br>And plant thy roses there.</br>Bid the black phantoms urge their flight</br>Enshrowded in the rear of night,</br>And point to where the heav'nly choir</br>Their blooming garlands weave, and sweep the golden lyre.

So when the day of life is o'er,</br>And night's black veil is closing fast,</br>May Mem'ry yield her treasur'd store,</br>And point to moments past—</br>May tranquil Virtue hover near,</br>Her faithful Vot'ry's end to cheer;</br>The grisly Tyrant's frown beguile,</br>And shew the gates of bliss expanding at her smile!</br>
